domains.name: Fine Structure Constant
domains.description: The framework's flagship result: alpha derived from division algebra dimensions with zero free parameters.
domains.narrative: The fine structure constant is derived as 1/alpha = n_c^2 + n_d^2 + n_d/(n_c * n_d + n_c) = 137 + 4/111 from division algebra dimensions alone. Tree-level matches to 0.27 ppm. With the C_2 = 24/11 radiative dressing, agreement improves to 0.0002 ppm (0.0009 ppm verified). Three-loop D_3 = 1 conjecture (HRS 5) would push to 0.0001 ppb. Two early attempts (GUT-scale alpha, 58/137 mechanism) are documented failures.
domains.caveat: All tree-level formulas are post-hoc. Dressing formula C_2 = 24/11 has [DERIVATION] status.

domains.name: Electroweak Mixing
domains.description: Weinberg angle derived from division algebra dimensions, with 3 early attempts falsified before success.
domains.keyResult: sin^2(theta_W) = 28/121 matches at 0.00 sigma with radiative correction
domains.narrative: The electroweak mixing angle is derived as sin^2(theta_W) = 28/121 = (n_d * Im_O) / n_c^2, where 28 = 4 x 7 and 121 = 11^2. This gives tree-level 0.23140, and with the radiative correction -alpha/(4*pi^2), the dressed value matches the PDG measurement at 0.00 sigma. Three earlier attempts (2/25, n_EW=5, borrowed 3/8) were falsified and documented. The cos(theta_W) = 171/194 on-shell formula matches to 3.75 ppm.
domains.caveat: Sensitive to m_W measurement; CDF tension unresolved.

domains.name: CMB Physics
domains.description: Six of seven blind CMB predictions confirmed within 1 sigma. Strongest statistical evidence in the framework.
domains.keyResult: 6/7 blind predictions pass: l_1 = 220 exact, n_s = 193/200, z_rec = 1090
domains.narrative: CMB is the framework's most statistically robust domain because 6/7 predictions were blind (locked before checking data) and 6 passed within 1 sigma. The first acoustic peak l_1 = 220 is an exact integer match. Higher peaks (l_4-l_6) were cleanly falsified at 12-19% error, providing the framework's most honest falsification. CMB-S4 will decisively test the tensor-to-scalar ratio r = 0.035 prediction around 2028.

domains.name: Dark Matter
domains.description: Framework predicts pNGB dark matter at 5.11 GeV. Particle identity remains open.
domains.keyResult: pNGB singlet mass = m_e * (n_c - 1)^n_d = 5.11 GeV, testable by SuperCDMS
domains.narrative: The framework derives that coset space SU(4)/Sp(4) produces exactly one pNGB singlet with Higgs quantum numbers [THEOREM]. The mass formula m_DM = m_e * 10^4 = 5.11 GeV follows from the determinant of the perspective counting matrix with n_d = 4. However, the DM particle identity (what couples, stability mechanism) remains OPEN as of S335. SuperCDMS SNOLAB reaching the 5 GeV mass range in 2026-2027 will be decisive.
domains.caveat: DM coupling and stability mechanism not yet derived. det(M) candidate under investigation.

domains.name: Cosmological Parameters
domains.description: Hubble constant and density parameters derived from division algebra numerology with sub-percent precision.
domains.keyResult: H_0 = 337/5 = 67.4 km/s/Mpc exact match; Omega_m = 63/200 derived from HS equipartition
domains.narrative: Three key cosmological parameters (H_0, Omega_m, Omega_Lambda) are derived from division algebra dimensions. Omega_m = 63/200 was genuinely derived in S293 via Hilbert space equipartition. Seven confirmed predictions at sub-1% precision, plus two falsified attempts (eta* and c_s). However, Omega_Lambda has a triple formula red flag: three incompatible derivation routes give the same answer, suggesting at least two are numerological accidents.
domains.caveat: Triple formula RED FLAG: Omega_Lambda has 3 incompatible derivation paths.

domains.name: Big Bang Nucleosynthesis
domains.description: BBN predictions include a potential solution to the 40-year cosmological lithium problem.
domains.keyResult: Li-7 abundance suppression factor of 3 solves the cosmological lithium problem
domains.narrative: BBN predictions derive primordial element abundances from framework crystallization dynamics. Y_p = 1/4 - 1/242 and D/H = alpha^2 * 10/21 match observations at sub-percent level. The most significant result is the Li-7 suppression by factor 3, which addresses a 40-year discrepancy between standard BBN predictions and observed lithium abundance. This is uniquely valuable: it explains an existing puzzle rather than just matching a known number.

domains.name: Neutrino Physics
domains.description: Neutrino mass ratios predicted from division algebra products, at percent-level precision.
domains.keyResult: R_31 = Im_H * n_c = 33, R_32 = H * O = 32 (both ~1.7% from NuFIT)
domains.narrative: Neutrino mass ratios are predicted as simple products of division algebra dimensions: R_31 = 3 * 11 = 33 and R_32 = 4 * 8 = 32. Both match NuFIT 5.2 data at ~1.7-1.8% precision. However, individually these are not statistically significant (p ~ 12.5% for random division algebra product match), and R_32 is not independent from R_31. JUNO and DUNE will improve mass-squared difference measurements.
domains.caveat: Individually not significant (p ~ 12.5%). R_32 not independent from R_31.

domains.name: Generation Structure
domains.description: Three generations of fermions derived from division algebra triality. No numerical predictions.
domains.keyResult: 3 generations from SO(8) triality acting on octonion algebra
domains.narrative: The three-generation structure of the Standard Model is derived from the triality automorphism of SO(8), the isometry group of the octonion norm. This connects the three irreducible representations (vector, spinor, conjugate spinor) to the three fermion generations. The result is structural rather than numerical: it explains why 3, but does not predict any mass ratios between generations from first principles.

domains.name: QCD / Strong Force
domains.description: SU(3) color derived from octonion automorphisms. Yang-Mills mass gap derivation rated canonical.
domains.keyResult: Yang-Mills mass gap with base mass n_d = 4, large-N coefficient 10/3 + 2/N^2
domains.narrative: SU(3) color symmetry is derived as G_2 (octonion automorphisms) breaking to SU(3) when a preferred direction is chosen by the complex structure. The Yang-Mills mass gap derivation is rated CANONICAL by the quality engine, with base mass scale n_d = 4 and large-N behavior 10/3 + 2/N^2. Two hadron mass ratio predictions reach Tier 1 precision, though the Xi0/d-quark ratio has illusory precision due to ~10% d-quark mass uncertainty.

domains.name: Gravity & Spacetime
domains.description: Einstein field equations derived from gamma-structure, but all quantitative gravity predictions falsified.
domains.keyResult: EFE derived from perspective gamma-structure [DERIVATION], but no numerical success
domains.narrative: Gravity is the framework's weakest domain. While Einstein field equations have been derived from the perspective gamma-structure at the level of [DERIVATION], all five quantitative gravity predictions have been falsified: G from perspective count (~50% error), Planck length (~10x error), Bekenstein-Hawking factor (proportionality only), and h(gamma) (withdrawn as untestable). The cosmological constant magnitude gap (~10^111) remains the largest unsolved problem.
domains.caveat: All 5 quantitative gravity predictions falsified. CC magnitude gap ~10^111.

domains.name: Quantum Mechanics
domains.description: Born rule and projection postulate derived from perspective axioms. Rated A-grade structural result.
domains.keyResult: Born rule derived: probability = |<psi|phi>|^2 from perspective overlap
domains.narrative: The framework derives the axioms of quantum mechanics from perspective geometry. The Born rule (probability as squared amplitude) follows from the overlap between perspectives: the fraction of internal structure shared between two viewpoints. The projection postulate follows from the completeness of each perspective. Complex Hilbert space structure follows from the F = C selection. This is rated the framework's strongest structural result, though it produces no falsifiable numerical predictions.

domains.name: Beyond Standard Model
domains.description: Colored pNGB and absence of extra Higgs as testable BSM predictions at current colliders.
domains.keyResult: Colored pNGB at 1320-2200 GeV; no 95 GeV scalar (falsification test for AXM_0109)
domains.narrative: The framework predicts a colored pseudo-Nambu-Goldstone boson from SU(4)/Sp(4) coset with mass 1761 GeV (central, g_rho = 4), range 1320-2200 GeV. Current LHC scalar leptoquark limits already reach 1500-1800 GeV, making this directly testable. Additionally, a 95 GeV scalar discovery at 5-sigma would falsify AXM_0109 (no extra Higgs prediction). Both tests are accessible at the HL-LHC.
domains.caveat: g_rho = n_d = 4 coupling is [CONJECTURE]. Mass range is parametric, not sharp.
